summary: This is an email forwarded to the FBI from March 3, 2021, containing a personal account. The sender describes an interaction with a man named Ernst, who allegedly claimed to belong to a 'special group' and made disturbing statements about 'children's blood and sex.' The email references a necklace and a person named 'Lens' who intervened.

persons.name: Ernst
persons.context: Described by the email sender as a man who claimed to belong to a special group and spoke about 'children's blood and sex,' showing a necklace.

persons.name: Lens
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who told Ernst he 'said too much' during the described interaction.

connections.description: Lens was present during Ernst's statements and intervened to tell Ernst he 'said too much,' indicating they were acquainted.

events.title: Disturbing conversation with Ernst
events.description: An individual named Ernst told the email sender he belonged to a special group and made statements about 'children's blood and sex,' showing a necklace. Lens intervened, saying Ernst said too much.

keyFacts: The document is an email forwarded to the FBI, dated March 3, 2021.
It contains a first-person account of a man named Ernst claiming to belong to a 'special group' and making allegations involving 'children's blood and sex.'
A person named Lens intervened during the conversation, telling Ernst he 'said too much.'
The sender initially dismissed the claims as 'gross' but considered the moment memorable.
The email subject line suggests it was an external communication forwarded to FBI personnel in New York.
